_infoMain.title: Please read this first!
_infoMain.description: This form changes dynamically based on the options you select or deselect. Options that are not needed will be hidden, and only the options that match your configuration will be displayed. Please start your configuration by selecting the way you want Privileges to work from the menu above. If you don't want to configure certain options, please disable them using the "Add/Remove properties" button above. For more information about Privileges and its configuration options, please visit our GitHub page.

_info.title: Important:
_info.description: You are configuring Privileges with forced administrator privileges. Therefore, most of the configuration options are not visible because they can't be used when Privileges is running in a locked mode.

_info.title: Important:
_info.description: You are configuring Privileges with forced standard user privileges. Therefore, most of the configuration options are not visible because they can't be used when Privileges is running in a locked mode.

_info.title: Important:
_info.description: You are configuring Privileges with forced current privileges. Therefore, most of the configuration options are not visible because they can't be used when Privileges is running in a locked mode.

AllowCLIBiometricAuthentication.title: Allow CLI Biometric Authentication
AllowCLIBiometricAuthentication.description: Specifies whether to allow biometric authentication in the PrivilegesCLI to obtain administrator privileges. When set to true, the Privileges agent prompts the user for the account password (or Touch ID, if available).

AllowPrivilegeRenewal.title: Allow Privilege Renewal
AllowPrivilegeRenewal.description: Specifies whether expiring administrator privileges can be renewed. If set to true, the user will receive a notification one minute before administrator privileges expire. The notification includes a Renew button that can be used to renew administrator privileges.

EnableSmartCardSupport.title: Enable Smart Card Support
EnableSmartCardSupport.description: Specifies whether to enable smart card support for authentication. Since the modern Local Authentication framework does not yet support smart cards/PIV tokens, enabling this option will cause the application to fall back to the older Authorization Services.

ExpirationInterval.title: Fixed Expiration Interval
ExpirationInterval.description: Set a fixed time interval after which administrator privileges expire and revert to standard user rights. A value of 0 disables the timeout and allows the user to request permanent administrator privileges.

ExpirationIntervalMax.title: Maximum Expiration Interval
ExpirationIntervalMax.description: Set a maximum time interval for a user to request administrator privileges. This generally works the same way as the fixed interval, but allows the user to choose any timeout value up to the specified one. For example, if the administrator sets the maximum interval to 20 minutes, the user can set it to any value up to 20 minutes instead of being forced to use the 20 minute timeout. For ease of use, we recommend configuring a maximum expiration interval rather than a fixed expiration interval.

HelpButtonCustomURL.title: Help Button Custom URL
HelpButtonCustomURL.description: If specified, this url is called instead of the Privileges GitHub url if the user clicks the help button. Malformed urls and non-http(s) urls are ignored.

en.error_pattern: Please enter a valid http(s) url

HideHelpButton.title: Hide Help Button
HideHelpButton.description: If set to true, the Help (?) button is no longer displayed in the app.

HideOtherWindows.title: Hide Other Windows
HideOtherWindows.description: By default, Privileges hides open windows to show the desktop and ensure that only the Privileges window is visible on the screen. Set HideOtherWindows to false to disable this function.

HideSettingsButton.title: Hide Settings Button
HideSettingsButton.description: If set to true, the Settings button is no longer displayed in the app.

HideSettingsFromDockMenu.title: Hide Settings From Dock Menu
HideSettingsFromDockMenu.description: If set to true, the Settings menu item is no longer displayed in the Dock tile's menu.

HideSettingsFromStatusItem.title: Hide Settings From Status Item
HideSettingsFromStatusItem.description: If set to true, the Settings menu item is no longer displayed in the status item's menu.

LimitToGroup.title: Limit To Group
LimitToGroup.description: Restricts use of the application to the specified list of groups.

options.infoText: Please enter the name of a user group.

en.error_pattern: Please enter a valid group name

LimitToUser.title: Limit To User
LimitToUser.description: Restricts use of the application to the specified list of users. When used with a client management system that supports variables in configuration profiles, variables such as $USERNAME can be used here.

options.infoText: Please enter a user's short name.

en.error_pattern: Please enter a valid user name

MaxIntervalInitial.title: Initial Value Of The Expiration Interval
MaxIntervalInitial.description: Sets the initial time interval if ExpirationIntervalMax has been configured. If not set and the user never selected an expiration interval, the initial expiration interval is set to 20 minutes. If you want to define an expiration interval that is less than the maximum expiration interval, use this option to define it. As mentioned earlier, this option has no effect if a user has already selected an expiration interval.

PassReasonToExecutable.title: Pass Reason To Executable
PassReasonToExecutable.description: Specifies whether the reason that the user entered when requesting administrator privileges should be passed to the executable configured with the PostChangeExecutablePath key. This is disabled by default. If enabled, the reason is passed to the executable as $3.

PostChangeActionOnGrantOnly.title: Post Change Action On Grant Only
PostChangeActionOnGrantOnly.description: If set to true, the application or script, specified in PostChangeExecutablePath, will only be executed if administrator privileges are granted to a user, but not the privileges are revoked.

PostChangeExecutablePath.title: Post Change Executable Path
PostChangeExecutablePath.description: If set, the PrivilegesAgent executes the given application or script and provides the current user's user name ($1) and its privileges (admin or user, $2) as launch arguments. If the application or script does not exist or is not executable, the launch operation fails silently.

options.infoText: Please enter the absolute path to the script or binary.

ReasonCheckingEnabled.title: Reason Checking Enabled
ReasonCheckingEnabled.description: If set to true, the text the user enters for a reason is roughly parsed for valid words. If the text does not contain any valid words, the Request Privileges button remains grayed out, even if the minimum number of characters has been entered. The test passes if the text contains any valid words, even if they don't make sense. This feature is experimental and disabled by default. If you enable it, please check carefully that it works as expected in your environment.

ReasonMaxLength.title: Reason Max Length
ReasonMaxLength.description: If ReasonRequired is set to true, this key specifies the maximum number of characters the user can enter as the reason for becoming an admin. If not set, the value defaults to 250. If a value > 250 is specified or if ReasonMaxLength is <= ReasonMinLength, the value is set to default.

ReasonMinLength.title: Reason Min Length
ReasonMinLength.description: If ReasonRequired is set to true, this key specifies the minimum number of characters the user has to enter as the reason for becoming an admin. If not set, the value defaults to 10. If a value < 1 is specified or if ReasonMinLength is > 250, the value is set to default.

ReasonPresetList.title: Reason Preset List
ReasonPresetList.description: If ReasonRequired is set to true, this key allows to pre-define a list of possible reasons (for becoming an admin) the user can choose from. If set, an additional pop-up menu will appear in the dialog box. This only works for the GUI version of Privileges.

ReasonRequired.title: Reason Required
ReasonRequired.description: When set to true, the user must provide a reason for requesting administrator privileges. The reason is logged. Note that once this option is enabled, privileges cannot be changed from the Privileges Dock tile menu or the status item menu.

ServerAddress.title: Syslog Server Address
ServerAddress.description: The server address can be an ip address or a fully-qualified domain name (FQDN).

en.error_pattern: Please enter an ip address or a fully-qualified domain name (FQDN)

MaximumMessageSize.title: Maximum Message Size
MaximumMessageSize.description: If not specified, the value defaults to 480 which is the minimum maximum message size a syslog server must support. If the syslog message is larger than the specified maximum, the message will be truncated at the end. Please see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5424#section-6.1 for further information.

MessageFormat.title: Message Format
MessageFormat.description: Configure the format of the syslog message.

ServerPort.title: Server Port
ServerPort.description: The port of the logging server. If not specified, the port defaults to 514 or to 6514 if TLS is enabled.

options.infoText: Starting with version 2, Privileges no longer supports syslog over UDP. So please make sure your syslog server accepts TCP connections when upgrading to Privileges 2.

StructuredData.title: Structured Data
StructuredData.description: Each SD element contains an SD id (which is the name of the element in the form of a string) and SD parameters. SD parameters are defined in a dictionary. The values of this dictionary must be of type string. Keys must be US-ASCII. Spaces and some special characters are not allowed.

UseTLS.title: Use TLS
UseTLS.description: If set to true, TLS is enabled for the connection. Please make sure your clients have a certificate installed that matches Apple's requirements. Please see https://support.apple.com/en-us/103769 for further information.

ServerAddress.title: Webhook URL
ServerAddress.description: The webhook url must be a http(s) url.

en.error_pattern: Please enter a valid http(s) url

WebhookCustomData.title: Webhook Custom Data
WebhookCustomData.description: You may use this dictionary to pass custom data (like the machine name, serial number, Jamf Pro ID, etc.) to the webhook. This data is added to the webhook's json as custom_data.

QueuedEventsMax.title: Maximum Number Of Queued Events
QueuedEventsMax.description: Specifies the maximum number of queued events. If not set, a maximum of 20 events will be queued. If set to 0, an unlimited number of events will be  queued.

QueueUnsentEvents.title: Queue Unsent Events
QueueUnsentEvents.description: When set to true, syslog and webhook events that could not be sent are queued. When a user changes privileges, PrivilegesAgent attempts to resend these events. For webhook events, these resent events have the "delayed" key set to true. The maximum number of queued events can be set using the "QueuedEventsMax" key. If not set, a maximum of 20 events will be queued.

RenewalCustomAction.title: Renewal Custom Action
RenewalCustomAction.description: Specifies a custom action to notify the user about expiring administrator privileges. If configured, the default expiration notifications are disabled and the executable specified by the ExecutablePath key is launched instead. An optional ActionNotificationInterval can be configured to specify how many minutes before the admin privileges expire the executable should be launched. If not configured, or the configured value is smaller than 1 or bigger than the expiration interval - 1, it defaults to 1 minute. The notification interval is also passed to the executable as the $1 argument.

ActionExecutablePath.title: Action Executable Path
ActionExecutablePath.description: If configured, the default renewal notifications are disabled and the specified executable is launched instead.

options.infoText: Please enter the absolute path to the script or binary.

en.error_pattern: Please enter an absulute file path

ActionNotificationInterval.title: Action Notification Interval
ActionNotificationInterval.description: This optional value can be configured to specify how many minutes before the admin privileges expire the executable should be launched. If not configured, or the configured value is smaller than 1 or bigger than the expiration interval - 1, it defaults to 1 minute. The notification interval is also passed to the executable configured using ActionExecutablePath as the $1 argument.

RenewalFollowsAuthSetting.title: Renewal Follows Auth Setting
RenewalFollowsAuthSetting.description: If set to true, renewing privileges requires the same kind of authentication as initially requesting administrator privileges.

RequireAuthentication.title: Require Authentication
RequireAuthentication.description: Specifies whether authentication is required to obtain administrator privileges. If set to true, the user is prompted for the account password (or Touch ID, if available). Note that once this option is enabled, privileges cannot be changed from the Privileges Dock tile menu unless AllowCLIBiometricAuthentication is also enabled.

RequireBiometricAuthentication.title: Require Biometric Authentication
RequireBiometricAuthentication.description: Specifies whether biometric authentication is required to obtain administrator privileges. If set to true, the PrivilegesAgent prompts the user for Touch ID and does not offer an alternative option. If Touch ID is unavailable or has not been configured, the user is prompted for their account password instead.

RevokeAtLoginExcludedUsers.title: Revoke At Login Excluded Users
RevokeAtLoginExcludedUsers.description: If RevokePrivilegesAtLogin is set to true, the specified users are excluded from privilege revocation at login. When used with a client management system that supports variables in configuration profiles, variables such as $USERNAME can be used here.

options.infoText: Please enter a user's short name.

en.error_pattern: Please enter a valid user name

RevokePrivilegesAtLogin.title: Revoke Privileges At Login
RevokePrivilegesAtLogin.description: If set to true, the user's administrator privileges are revoked at login. For those who use fixed admin accounts on their machines: If you want to enable this feature, please make sure you exclude the admin account(s) using the RevokeAtLoginExcludedUsers key. Otherwise these accounts become standard user accounts at next log in.

ShowInMenuBar.title: Show In Menu Bar
ShowInMenuBar.description: If set to true, a Privileges status item is displayed in the Menu Bar.
